attributes.action: abolish proposals to allow the BBC licence fee to fund ITV or any other commercial broadcaster
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The recent Digital Britain report outlined by Culture Secretary Ben Bradshaw in Parliament includes a proposal to allow up to £130m of BBC licence fee money to be allocated to ITV to fund certain programmes. Mr Bradshaw said in the House of Commons that the BBC did not have "exclusive rights" to the licence fee.

What Mr Bradshaw seemingly fails to recognise is that ITV is a commercial TV station. It is funded on it's principal of showing commercial media - adverts.

The public should not be forced to PAY for being force fed adverts?

This is wrong and should be stopped now!
